p: Furthermore, other Zingiber spp. have also shown phytotoxicity against different weeds; for instance, Z. zerumbet Smith, with zerumbone (74.82%) as its major compound, affected the seedling growth of Philaris minor Retz. in a concentration-dependent manner, achieving inhibition of both the hypocotyl and radicle development at 1000 ppm and showing less or no effect on the germination of seeds of Triticum aestivum L. [ 53].
